ch.powerunit

Interface AssertThatString

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AssertThatCastableObject<String>, AssertThatObject<String>

    public interface AssertThatString
extends AssertThatCastableObject<String>
    DSL for assertion on string result.

    This interface is returned by the various methods assertThat exposed by TestSuite.

    Author:
    borettim

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default boolean containsString(String substring)
      Check that a string another string.
      default boolean endsWith(String prefix)
      Check that a string ends with another one.
      default boolean matchesRegex(Pattern pattern)
      Validate a string with a Pattern.
      default boolean matchesRegex(String regex)
      Validate a string with a regex.
      default boolean startsWith(String prefix)
      Check that a string starts with another one.

      • Methods inherited from interface ch.powerunit.AssertThatCastableObject

        as, as

      • Methods inherited from interface ch.powerunit.AssertThatObject

        is, is, isA, isNot, isNot, isNotNull, isNull

    • Method Detail

      • containsString

        default boolean containsString(String substring)
        Check that a string another string.

        This method is a shortcut to is(containsString(substring)).

        By default, assertion can only be used from the main thread of the test ; When used from another thread, the assertion will be lost. In the case the fastFail attribute of @Test annotation is used, the assertion may not be lost, in case the thread use an assertion method from the test object instance.

        Parameters:
        substring - the other string.
        Returns:
        true if the assertion is valid ; If the assertion is false, depending on Test.fastFail() : If true, then fail the test, else, return false and the test will be failed later.
        See Also:
        The documentation of the fastFail attribute of the @Test annotation, regarding the action done by this assertion.

      • startsWith

        default boolean startsWith(String prefix)
        Check that a string starts with another one.

        This method is a shortcut to is(startsWith(prefix)).

        By default, assertion can only be used from the main thread of the test ; When used from another thread, the assertion will be lost. In the case the fastFail attribute of @Test annotation is used, the assertion may not be lost, in case the thread use an assertion method from the test object instance.

        Parameters:
        prefix - the prefix.
        Returns:
        true if the assertion is valid ; If the assertion is false, depending on Test.fastFail() : If true, then fail the test, else, return false and the test will be failed later.
        See Also:
        The documentation of the fastFail attribute of the @Test annotation, regarding the action done by this assertion.

        Check that a string ends with another one.

      • matchesRegex

        default boolean matchesRegex(Pattern pattern)
        Validate a string with a Pattern.

        This method is a shortcut to is(matchesRegex(pattern)).

        By default, assertion can only be used from the main thread of the test ; When used from another thread, the assertion will be lost. In the case the fastFail attribute of @Test annotation is used, the assertion may not be lost, in case the thread use an assertion method from the test object instance.

        Parameters:
        pattern - the pattern to be used.
        Returns:
        true if the assertion is valid ; If the assertion is false, depending on Test.fastFail() : If true, then fail the test, else, return false and the test will be failed later.
        See Also:
        The documentation of the fastFail attribute of the @Test annotation, regarding the action done by this assertion.

      • matchesRegex

        default boolean matchesRegex(String regex)
        Validate a string with a regex.

        This method is a shortcut to is(matchesRegex(regex)).

        By default, assertion can only be used from the main thread of the test ; When used from another thread, the assertion will be lost. In the case the fastFail attribute of @Test annotation is used, the assertion may not be lost, in case the thread use an assertion method from the test object instance.

        Parameters:
        regex - The regex to be used for the validation.
        Returns:
        true if the assertion is valid ; If the assertion is false, depending on Test.fastFail() : If true, then fail the test, else, return false and the test will be failed later.
        See Also:
        The documentation of the fastFail attribute of the @Test annotation, regarding the action done by this assertion.
